Title: Police, DSS arrest gun fixer, food, fuel suppliers to bandits in Kwara
Summary: Aftermath of last Tuesday bandit attack on church worshippers in Eruku area of Ekiti local government, Kwara State . Security agencies in the state have arrested a man from Makurdi, Benue State alleged to be fixing guns for bandits .

Title: PINL intensifies moves to curb pipeline vandalism on TNP Corridor
Summary: Pipeline Infrastructure Nigeria Limited (PIPL) has launched a community-based communication initiative that deploys local town criers to increase security awareness along the Eastern Corridor of the Trans Niger Pipeline . PINL intensifies moves to curb pipeline vandalism on TNP Corridor .

Title: NOC commends Sunshine schools for hosting successful sports administration course
Summary: The Nigeria Olympic Committee commended Sunshine Schools, Ibadan, for hosting a three-day Sports Administration Course . Organised by Olympic Solidarity and the NOC in collaboration with Dynaspro Sports and Sunshine Schools .

Title: Nigerian Football – What next
Summary: Nigeria was once described as the ‘Giant of Africa’ The country was ranked fifth on the FIFA table, and the Super Eagles were hailed as the most entertaining national team during the 1994 World Cup .

Title: Vervelife 8.0 grand finale thrills Lagos’ fitness enthusiasts, sports
Summary: Over 10,100 fitness enthusiasts, sports fans, lifestyle lovers and lifestyle lovers participated in the two-part grand finale of the VerveLife 8.0 held at Eko Convention Centre, Victoria Island, Lagos . Winners get car, cash prizes .

Title: Obasanjo trains 1,000 secondary school prefects on ethics, responsibility, leadership
Summary: The programme drew 1,000 head boys, head girls and senior prefects from secondary schools across Ogun State . Obasanjo trains them on ethics, responsibility, leadership .

Title: Fossil fuel fight threatens to sink COP30 as negotiations run into overtime
Summary: Negotiations at COP30 climate talks in Brazil ran into overtime on Saturday with no agreement struck . Delegates still locked in a bitter fight over whether to mention fossil fuels in the final text .

Title: Aftershock rocks Bangladesh as quake death toll rises to 10
Summary: Aftershock rocks Bangladesh as quake death toll rises to 10 . "There has been no massive earthquake in the last 100 years or more, but Bangladesh has been vulnerable for quite some time"

Title: ‎NAICOM directs insurance customers to link NIN to policies
Summary: NAICOM also directed corporate clients to provide Certificate of Incorporation documents before the deadline . Insurance customers must link NIN to policies .

Title: Why I left panel investigating Timipre Sylva – Seriake Dickson
Summary: Seriake Dickson: "I know they don’t treat me same way. When they are in a position to bring me down, they don't spare anything... But to the glory of God, they have not succeeded"

Title: Abducted Niger school pupils now 303 - CAN
Summary: The number of pupils and students abducted from the St Mary Private Primary and Secondary schools has risen to 303, according to the Niger State CAN . Title: FG postpones NAFEST 2025 over rising insecurity
Summary: Federal Ministry of Art, Culture, Tourism and Creative Economy, Hannatu Musawa, has announced postponement of the 2025 edition of the National Festival of Arts and Culture . Title: Soyinka slams Trump’s threat to send troops to Nigeria
Summary: Nobel laureate Wole Soyinka has criticised US President Donald Trump’s threat to deploy military forces to Nigeria . Title: Iran seeks help as fire engulfs UNESCO forests
Summary: Iran has requested foreign assistance in extinguishing a large fire that has ravaged UNESCO World Heritage-listed forests in the north of the country for several days . Title: Ukraine faces pressure over US war plan
Summary: The leaders of Germany, France, Britain and Ukraine stressed the need to safeguard "vital European and Ukrainian interests", Berlin said .
